title: Taskbar icon shows incorrect number of email
creator: davidhelp
content:
Taskbar icon shows incorrect number of email. Question: Anyone else having this issue? Any fix? Today the Sent - my email address taskbar button shows 98 In Thunderbird I have only 2 new sent messages from 4-18 and none for 4-19. I have 9550 overall.

My Inbox on various days show 75 or 14 or 8 BTW I never get more then a few messages at a time so seeing 75 or 14 or 8 would never be correct.

I go to download and none show up. I have the number of Total message count already downloaded displayed and the number does not change. Any new message would also be in Bold.

I disabled the showing on the Taskbar and as an example when I go to check messages and it says 1 of 1 yet none show up.

I have even moved all my Inbox email to a subfolder and no new email will show up in the Inbox when the program says I will have lots. I checked my domain cPanel email and no new email either.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0

title: Nefunkční tisk PDF z Thunderbird
creator: m.cuhel
content: Dobrý den. Po aktualizaci Thunderbird na verzi 136.x,x a novější mi přestal fungovat tisk PDF dokumentů z emailů. Dokument v okně náhledu v Thunderbird vidím, ale vytiskne se vždy prázdná stránka. Ve verzi 128.x.x bylo funkční. Také mám problém se zobrazením obsahů emailů v některých podsložkách v POP3 účtech. Seznam emailů v aplikaci vidím, ale pokud chci email otevřít, tak nevidím žádný obsah. Datový soubor se zdá OK, protože když ho otevřu třeba v MBOX Viewer, tak obsah i včetně příloh vidím. Zkusil jsem přeinstalovat, vymazat cache soubory, ale stále nefunkční. Děkuji za případnou radu.

title: One email (of 5) is not receiving
creator: roger.munt
content: To recap: I have been using Thunderbird for years. It receives 5 email channels and was working fine up until a few weeks back. I can still use it to send on that channel just not receive. Since it is Imap I can access it ok on the network providers web site (Talktalk) I can also receive it ok on an Amazon Fire tablet. I have tried turning off aspects of my antivirus (Bitdefender) but it doesn't seem to help. At the bottom edge of the Thunderbird screen I can see various sets of words which seem to indicate it is accessing the Imap channel just that nothing appears. In case it helps the email address is of the form xxxxx.xxxxx@lineone.net. Someone helpfully provided a list of suggested problem areas but they either don't apply or they seem to be ok. Regards, Roger
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/cannot-receive-messages", "/en-US/kb/thunderbird-78-faq", "/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-logjam", "/en-US/kb/new-thunderbird-78"]

title: Thunderbird suddenly stopped send/receive with 'certificate errors'
creator: jack152
content: Been using and loving Thunderbird for over 10 years - now on 115.18.0 (32-bit) with 8 different email addresses, all on 'ionos.co.uk'. My AV is Norton and seemed to 'upgrade' to 'Norton for Gamers' 2 days ago. Since then attempts to read messages get a pop-up window titled 'Add Security Exception' with text 'You are about to override how Thunderbird identifies this site. Legitimate banks, stores will not ask you to do this. ' It gives location as 'imap.ionos.co,uk;993' then a line says 'This site attempts to identifiy itself with invalid information'. Clicking button marked View shows details that include 'Organisation: Norton Web/Mail Shield' hence my suspicion. I've had a lengthy call with Ionos support, very patient and helpful, checking things at their end, concluding nothing of theirs has changed and all is working correctly. I tried one of the addresses using their webmail, which worked perfectly. About the same time that this happened, I started getting pop-up messages from Norton when I started software programs that I wrote myself some years ago. That's never happened before! Tried reading Norton help pages but cannot get hold of a human. Has anyone else had this problem? Should I ditch Norton? Many thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0
